bullets.text: Tariffs are expected to show up more in consumer prices as holiday shopping season starts.
Treasury sets Series I bond rate at 4.03% for the next six months.
Despite falling interest rates, investors keep buying money market funds for liquidity and yield.
Tech's $380 billion AI spending spree is reshaping winners and losers this quarter.
As big tech maxes AI spending, subscription and software prices may rise for consumers.
Chevron beats estimates as oil production hits record, boosted by Hess acquisition.
Exxon in advanced talks to power AI data centers with natural gas and carbon capture.
Samsung building facility with 50,000 Nvidia GPUs to automate chip manufacturing.
Nvidia's Jensen Huang downplays national security concerns over China sales, says Beijing has 'plenty' chips.
Federal judge orders U.S. to continue paying SNAP benefits during government shutdown.
ACA open enrollment brings 'huge sticker shock' as enhanced subsidies fade and premiums rise.
Government shutdown delays mortgage and insurance processing, leaving home buyers in limbo.
Fed releases revised estimates of U.S. industrial capacity, informing output gap and investment analysis.
Atrocities surge again in Darfur, deepening humanitarian crisis and regional instability risks.
